column1: The Two Watchers were two carved figures that guarded the gateway of the Tower of Cirith Ungol with a strange and malevolent will
column2: inhabited by "some dreadful spirits (creatures) of evil vigilance". Each was formed of three bodies - one guarding the way into the tower
column4: and the third staring across the gateway itself. Their faces were the faces of vultures
column5: with eyes of black stone. They had the power to block entry to the tower
column7: through the force of their will alone
column8: and were able to send up a shrill alarm call if their guard was breached.

column1: 1980: The Return of the King (1980 film):
:Samwise Gamgee encounters the Watchers while attempting to enter the tower to rescue Frodo Baggins. He sets off the alarm
column2: but gets by them by using the Phial of Galadriel. When he and Frodo encounter them once again when trying to leave the tower
column3: they put up more of a resistance to the Phial
column4: but give in when Frodo helps Sam use it.
